entry.title: Bitcoin XT 0.11A
entry.summary: In a recent context, people are surprised with Mike Hearn's actions towards the Bitcoin community. However, a video from two months ago has surfaced that sheds light on the situation. The video in question is called "Mike Hearn's 'Worst Case' XT Fork Scenario: Checkpoints, Ignore Longest Chain" and can be found on YouTube. In the video, Hearn discusses the possibility of a fork in the Bitcoin network and how he thinks it should be handled. He suggests implementing checkpoints and ignoring the longest chain to ensure the safety and stability of the network.The discussion of a fork in the Bitcoin network has been a hot topic recently, and many members of the community have varying opinions on how it should be handled. Hearn's proposal for checkpoints and ignoring the longest chain is one approach that has been met with mixed reactions. Some believe it would be a good solution to prevent malicious attacks on the network, while others see it as a potential threat to the decentralized nature of Bitcoin.Overall, the video provides some insight into Hearn's thought process and his views on how to handle a potential fork in the network. While his recent actions have caused controversy within the community, it's important to consider all perspectives and understand the reasoning behind them. Watching this video may help individuals gain a better understanding of Hearn's position and the issues surrounding the Bitcoin network.
